page.title: 01Stourpaine & Durweston area
page.content: The land is in a valley with the River Stour running through it. At the side it is more hilly. Grass grows on the flat land for cows and sheep but some of the hills have woods on them. The villages are Durweston and Stourpaine and you can see their two churches. The houses look mostly old. You can see the banks where the old Somerset and Dorset Railway used to run. There are two busy main roads from Blandford. One is the A350 which goes to Shaftesbury and the other is the A357 to Sturminster Newton. They meet at Durweston Bridge where there are traffic lights. On Hod Hill there was an Iron Age village and you can still see the ditches and banks at the top.
